result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph A. Sullivan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph A. Sullivan

records.addlTxt:
Copy to LCSD on 10/11/2022
Copy mailed to Def on 10/11/2022
On def's failure to pay the fine, Court orders 10 days jail.

ADDRESS INFO for Joseph A. Sullivan
Current: P.O. Box 111, Neopit, WI 54150 United States  (Effective: 06-22-2022)
Prior: 1016 5th Ave #207, Antigo, WI 54409

1:14 PM in Room 203. Defendant Joseph A. Sullivan in court, in custody at Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Cana G Kohn in court for Joseph A. Sullivan.  Attorney Kelly L Hays in court for State of Wisconsin. 21CM124 and 22CM36. Court recites agreement. 21CM124: Def. to plead to Ct. 1 and Ct. 2. Joint Recommendation on both counts: Withheld sentence, 2 years probation, costs, AODA and any treatment, maintain absolute sobriety, complete domestic violence assessment and follow thru, fulltime work, counseling.   22CM36 - Def. to plead to Ct. 3. Joint recommendation: 45 days jail, costs. Ct. 1 and 2 to be DRI. Attny Kohn clarifies agreement. Def. in agreement. Plea questionnaire reviewed. 21CM124: Def. pleads to Ct. 1 - DC, no contest; Ct. 2 - Resisting/obstructing, no contest. 22CM36 - Ct. 3 - Bail jumping, no contest. Court grants State's motion to DRI Ct. 1 and Ct. 2 in 22CM36. Constitutional rights, elements and possible penalties reviewed. Attny Kohn is satisfied. The Court finds that Def. understands and that plea is freely and voluntarily given. Court finds there is a factual basis, accepts pleas and finds Def. guilty of Ct. 1 and 2 in 21CM124 and Ct. 3 in 22CM36. Sentencing remarks by State. State has complied with victim rights. No restitution. Sentencing remarks by Attny Kohn. Def. makes statement. Court questions Def. Remarks by the Court. 
The Court orders:
21CM124: Ct. 1- imp/stayed 45 days jail, 2 years probation, court costs only including DNA surcharge, DNA sample unless already provided, completion of AODA and follow through with any recommendations, maintain absolute sobriety, complete domestic violence assessment and follow thru with any recommendations, maintain full time employment, including daycare, 30 hours/week or apply for at least 5 jobs/week qualified for  participate in counseling as deemed beneficial by agent.  Ct 2: withheld sentence, 2 years probation, costs with DNA surcharge, same conditions as Ct. 1. 
22CM36 - Ct. 3:  40 days jail, Huber, costs only including DNA surcharge. 
Costs:  $500 cash bond on 21CM124 to be used toward costs on this case. Remainder to be paid during probation.  22CM36 payment plan.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
Credit: 
22CM36 - 33 days. 21CM124 - 4 days if revoked. 
Post-conviction rights.

records.addlTxt: 03:46 PM Defendant Joseph A. Sullivan in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph A. Sullivan appeared by video means.  All parties via zoom. Court reviews history of case. Def. makes statement. Def. will represent himself.  Court questions defendant. Court accepts waiver of counsel.  Not Guilty plea entered and received. Def. heard on bond modification.  Court advise def.  Court now calls 21CM124 same appearance set for Status on June 14th.  Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on June 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
regarding bond / Routed to CC's JA

Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  
No illegal use or possession of controlled substances.
No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. 
No contact with alleged victims.

01:18 PM Defendant Joseph A. Sullivan in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Joseph A. Sullivan appeared by video means. All parties via zoom.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. will be applying for a P.D. State gives bail/bond recommendation as gives conditions. Def. makes statement.  Court orders $600 cash bond with conditions  Maintain Absolute Sobriety.  No illegal use or possession of controlled substances. No presence in establishments with Class B liquor license. No contact with alleged victims.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
